pros: Amazing and hugely influential to me
cons: Better than I expected tbh

review_title: Brilliant place to work and excellent leadership
pros: I loved working at City Lit due to having brilliant and very supportive colleagues, fantastic leadership and a really lovely, collegiate culture. It was a very self-reflective and transparent place to work, where the Senior Leadership were open about what to improve and how they were doing this (for example, addressing the limited diversity amongst the leadership). They were also particularly forthcoming in prioritising their staff's wellbeing, especially during COVID-19, and were transparent and open about all decisions made, and acted on feedback.
cons: Sometimes the hours could be long, but taking TOIL was encouraged and whilst the salary is in line with other FE Colleges, the benefits and opportunities for development were readily available.

review_title: Freedom to devise courses, but precarious work
pros: Freedom to devise course content, good A/V support, friendly staff
cons: Courses would only run if enough students signed up, but of course course content would have to be written to ensure delivery, meaning sometimes time was wasted working on a course that ended up not being delivered and I could not be paid for my work.

review_title: Nice place to work, good office culture
pros: It is a kind and supportive office culture, very inclusive and tolerant. The annual leave is the best I've ever come across. Flexible working. A pretty caring place.
cons: Internal communications are poor. The good culture compensates for this - just!

review_title: Wonderful place to teach, issues in middle management
pros: -Amazing college with a brilliant offering, especially the SEND focussed areas. -The principle Mark really cares about the college and is really passionate. -Excellent place to teach, teaching departments are very supportive. -Support departments were always amazing, particularly the library staff and surrounding team who were warm and friendly, and IT were really great too. -Pay and benefits were excellent - Staff get access to heavily discounted courses which was great
cons: -Work/life balance is awful, common for management to be sending emails in the middle of the night. -It was an open secret that disagreeing with a certain high ranking staff member or his direct reports will result in dismissal - was warned in my first week that people who crossed him would be 'disappeared' and I know that this happen to 3 people while I worked there.

pros: Great place to work in central London
cons: None that I can think of

review_title: A creative atmosphere in which to work
pros: The place is buzzing with adults wanting to learn and practise a diverse range of arts, languages, performance skills, and subjects useful for employment and enjoyment. Teachers are self-motivated and autonomous
cons: Hourly paid tutors may find it hard to make a living solely from teaching, despite the generous hourly rate of pay, because there's no holiday pay and a lot of admin done in one's own time.

pros: The staff and the office atmosphere
cons: Management top heavy and too corporate

pros: Very supportive environment. Adapted quickly to covid. Lots of opportunity to develop.
cons: Salary is on low side.

review_title: Amazing small institution with a big impact
pros:
Friendly and welcoming environment with dedicated successful teams working across 4 major faculties delivering 2000+ short and long term courses to adults.
World class tutors and offering a great selection of diverse courses which staff have discounts on.
Great annual leave allowance and pension schemes + other staff support systems.
Located in Covent Garden - good transport links and environment.
Modern building - good for accessibility
cons: At times workload could be heavy due to wideness of course offer and funding rule changes but is well managed

pros: Great pay, holidays and location is great right in the center of London next to covent garden
cons: Organization is not great, often pay is wrong and departments have bad communication. Due to it being such an old institution

pros: City Lit is a very welcoming, friendly community of staff and adult learners.
cons: I don't think there are any cons to working for City Lit.

review_title: Nice place to work in heart of London
pros: Relaxed atmosphere, friendly environment, open plan office helps you to integrate.
cons: Occasional groupthink and tendency to be sceptical of new approaches.

pros: Great team of people to work with
cons: It feels like you are in a creative atmosphere but not included

job_title: TV and Radio Technician in London, England
pros:
The people are all very open, supportive and kind in general. 

The fact that we have people from so many different backgrounds, with a wide array of abilities and all doing classes together.

It's inclusive and thats its strength.
cons:
My studio is way under par for what we want to be teaching.

The funding for my studio needs to increase.

Theres nowhere near enough marketing and advertising done for our courses which needs to be addressed. 

No career opportunities for me in my role is massive down side.

job_title: Business Account Manager in London, England
pros: Creative and dedicated staff, great location and facilities, lively environment, long history of service, well recognized name in its sector, open and communicative culture, generous holiday entitlement, good pension provision and fair remuneration
cons: Not much to comment on here....perhaps some departments are a bit chaotic at times but that is to be expected from an adult education college

review_title: Thoughtful of both staff and students
pros: As teachers for City Lit, we feel valued and considered. There is a genuine sense that lives are changed for the better here. Pay is better than similar workplaces. Staff feel listened to.
cons: I’m not comfortable travelling on the Cental line at rush hour but hoping teaching online will work.

pros: Good flexibility and work life balance
cons: People there have very far left / liberal ideologies

pros: very helpful staff and nice school
cons: can't think of any, loved the job so much

pros: Good team and attitudes generally
cons: Can be a bit corporate for a colle e

pros: Good educational company, nice environment.
cons: Staff are not very warm
